item.title: Clash Royale Devs Acknowledge Jynxzi’s Contribution
item.content:encoded:
Clash Royale devs have amended their blog post to acknowledge Jynxzi’s contribution towards the title’s recent success.

The CEO and co-founder of SuperCell released a new blog post titled The Best Games Haven’t Been Made Yet. One of the focuses of the blog post was the historic year Clash Royale had, and fans, even Jynxzi, were not happy that the creator was not acknowledged for being influential in the game’s success.

Clash Royale Dev Finally Appreciates Jynxzi’s Influence

SuperCell’s CEO and co-founder, Ilkka Paananen, stated on X (formerly Twitter) that they have amended the Clash Royale category in the blog post following community reaction. Paananen accepted that the developers “failed to acknowledge the role that creators, pro players, and the broader community played in Clash Royale’s resurgence.” The CEO added that there was never an intent to “diminish anyone’s contribution”.

The blog post then talks about Clash Royale being celebrated through creators self-organizing tournaments, sharing of art and memes, and more. The blog post specially mentions Jynxzi, adding that the creator invested their “own time, money, and energy into bringing Clash Royale back to cultural relevance.” He also managed to introduce the title to many new players and some of the biggest names in streaming.

The blog reveals that Clash Royale’s re-engaged players have doubled, while new players have grown by almost 500%. Additionally, all measures of playtime and engagement grew successfully.

What are your thoughts on the Clash Royale developers finally acknowledging Jynxzi’s contribution? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Ubisoft reporting strong growth and beating expectations in its financial report. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Activity Surges 28% Year-on-Year
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft reported that Assassin’s Creed surpassed expectations this quarter, with session days increasing by 28% year-on-year and a significant growth in active users.

On February 12, 2026, Ubisoft reported its Q3 sales for the fiscal year. Not only did the company report that its net bookings were up 18% year-on-year, but it also noted that the Assassin’s Creed brand in particular overperformed, with a strong quarter that underscored the franchise’s strength.

Specifically, activity metrics for Assassin’s Creed were up, with double-digit growth in active users. In a quarter that saw the release of Assassin’s Creed Shadows on the Nintendo Switch 2 and updates for Assassin’s Creed Mirage, there was a 28% surge in activity year-on-year. There’s also a 7% increase from the previous quarter.

The Anticipated Assassin’s Creed Black Flag Remake Is Stalled for Now

While the Assassin’s Creed brand remains a tentpole franchise for Ubisoft, the highly anticipated remake of Assassin’s Creed: Black Flag is likely delayed. A previous report noted that an unannounced title planned for the fiscal year 2026 has been delayed to the fiscal year 2027. This point was reiterated during an investor call that followed the release of the sales report.

The remake of Black Flag is currently the only game that matches this description. Insider Gaming had reported that the project was slated for release this March. The brand recently underwent a major restructuring, resulting in the cancellation of the planned Prince of Persia: Sands of Time remake.

An art book centered on the forthcoming Black Flag remake was recently listed on Amazon. Learn more about that at this link.

For more on Ubisoft in Insider Gaming, check out further details on the company’s year-over-year increases.

How do you feel about the success of the AC franchise? Are you currently playing any games in the lineup? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: The Division’s 2026 Roadmap is ‘Ambitious’ and Includes Resurgence Launch
item.content:encoded:
In a recent financial update, Ubisoft touched on The Division, the post-apocalyptic shooter MMO that is preparing to celebrate its tenth anniversary. In March, The Division will be a decade old, and this year, Ubisoft plans to unveil an ‘ambitious’ roadmap that includes the launch of The Division: Resurgence.

While we don’t have a firm release date just yet, we now know that The Division: Resurgence, an authentic mobile-first experience, is planned for release between February and April 2026.

Big Things Are Coming to The Division This Year

Recently, Ubisoft quietly released The Division: Definitive Edition, which proved to be a disappointing drop for fans of the shooter series. It was assumed that the team at Massive would have produced something more significant for the game’s tenth anniversary, but the ‘special edition’ came without any frills whatsoever.

Regardless, Ubisoft has assured fans that a strong year is ahead for The Division.

In the recent financial update, which reported strong results, the team insisted that The Division: Resurgence, a mobile game with all the trappings of the core series, is planned for release in Q4 2025-2026. That means, all being well, we’ll have it before April. Right now, the game is undergoing tests that are slowly opening to include more territories.

Additionally, it was confirmed that The Division 2 will be getting ‘a new game mode’ for the tenth anniversary of the franchise, arriving in March 2026. When that date comes around, Ubisoft will take the opportunity to unveil ‘an ambitious roadmap’ for the year ahead.

Given the recent positivity and promising comments around The Division 3, by the recently departed Julian Gerighty, fans are full of anticipation for what lies ahead.

Are you looking forward to the release of The Division: Resurgence? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out how you can get GTA 6 for free

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

item.title: Ubisoft Reports Strong Growth and Beaten Expectations in Financial Report
item.content:encoded:
Ubisoft has finally published its latest financial report, outlining the Q3 2025 – 2026 performance portfolio across the company. In contrast to what you might generally believe, the company is in a strong place and is reporting beaten expectations across the board, with key franchises soaring year-over-year.

Assassin’s Creed, The Division, Anno, and Avatar are all up in terms of net bookings, contributing to a total €1.1 billion, up 18% year-over-year.

Ubisoft Reports Smooth Sailing in Financial Update

Ubisoft’s recent financial update opened with bold statements about the company’s performance. It was written that financial delivery in Q3 25-26 is ‘above expectations’ and hitting levels classed as an ‘overperformance’ based mostly on gains secured by Assassin’s Creed.

Rainbow Six Siege is also doing very well, as is Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, with a burst of success being secured by the game’s ‘strongly anticipated third-person update and high-quality From the Ashes expansion release.’

More than 130 million MAUs (Monthly Active Users) are being reported across the Ubisoft estate, covering both console and PC platforms, and in December, a 3% growth in MAUs was recorded year-over-year.

In a statement at the heart of the financial update, CEO and co-Founder, Yves Guillemot, said:

We delivered a solid third-quarter performance,with net bookings growing at a double-digit rate year-on-year, exceeding our expectations. This performance reflects the strength of our portfolio and the breadth of player engagement across our core franchises, supported by recent releases and live content updates that continue to resonate with players.

Ubisoft has been pushed from pillar to post in recent months. Days ago, much of the company participated in a walkout, mainly staged to oppose a five-day return to office order imposed by the company, and to recognize plummeting stock values.

The financial update didn’t refer to any of the recent troubles, nor did it outline anything to do with the recent crash in share price.

Are you surprised to hear that Ubisoft is doing well? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Dying Light has hit 50 million players

Written by

item.title: Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 Roadmap Revealed
item.content:encoded:
The roadmap for all the content players can expect in Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 across February, March, and April has been revealed.

Details about Battlefield 6 Season 2 have been available for a while, with developers announcing that it will offer more rewarding progression. They have increased the earning rates for Career and weapon XP. However, specific content had not been revealed until now. The newly released roadmap provides all the information players need.

Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 Roadmap Features New Maps, Weapons, Vehicles, Modes, and More

The latest X post (formerly Twitter) from CharlieIntel provides the Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 Roadmap and dates. The content has been divided across three months, February, March, and April; and it features 2 new maps, several limited-time modes, returning and new vehicles, new weapons, and more. Check out the complete Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 Roadmap below:

Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 February Content – Extreme Measures

The first update arrives on February 17 and it will include 1 new map, Contaminated and three limited time modes: VL-7 Strike, Gauntlet Altered State and BR-Synthesis. There’s some new hardware to look forward to, such the return of AH-6 Little Bird and introduction of MH-350 Helicopters. Also, there’s the GRT-CPS DMR, VCR-2 Assault Rifle, HTI-MK2 Gadget, M121 A2 Machine Gun and 9K38 IGLA Gadget.

Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 March Content – Nightfall

The next wave of content for Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 Roadmap arrives on March 17. This will introduce a new map again, Hagental Base and a limited-time event, Nightfall. There’s a new limited-time mode called Gauntlet Nightfall and a new place of interest, the Defense Testing Complex 3 – Fort Lyndon. Lastly, new hardware includes the M1030-1 bike, CZ3A1 Submachine Gun and VZ. 61 sidearm.

Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 April Content – Hunter/Prey

The last wave arrives of April 14 and it seems to be lighter on content. Players won’t receive a new map, and only one limited-time mode, Operation Augur. There will be Portal Updates and a new Bonus Path. Lastly, only 2 new hardware, the LTV vehicle and Ripper 14″ Machete melee weapon.

In other news, Battlefield 6 Season 2 is taking the action to Germany. Additionally, EA’s net bookings increased 38% year-over-year thanks to Battlefield 6. What are your thoughts on Battlefield 6 REDSEC Season 2 Roadmap? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Dyling Light celebrating new player milestone with new content and event. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
